oauth_demo

Class DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect

  • java.lang.Object
    • oauth_demo.DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect

  • public class DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods which implement the Dropbox No-Redirect workflow:
    • noRedirectClientStart implements the start step.
    • noRedirectClientFinishAndSave implements the finish step, saves the access token, and creates some sample files to show everything is working.
    These methods are both called by the client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static com.dropbox.core.DbxWebAuthNoRedirect noredirectClient
      Dropbox client object used to call authorisation functions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static AccessData noRedirectClientFinishAndSave(java.lang.String securityCode)
      This method implements the finish step of the Dropbox no-redirect workflow.
      static DropboxStatus noRedirectClientStart()
      This method implements the start step of the Dropbox no-redirect workflow.

    • Field Detail

      • noredirectClient

        public static com.dropbox.core.DbxWebAuthNoRedirect noredirectClient
        Dropbox client object used to call authorisation functions

    • Method Detail

      • noRedirectClientStart

        public static DropboxStatus noRedirectClientStart()
        This method implements the start step of the Dropbox no-redirect workflow. It passes the necessary parameters to DbxWebAuthNoRedirect.start() and returns the generated URL to the caller.
        Returns:
        DropboxStatus object which is initialised with the URL to which the user must be redirected to authorise with Dropbox.
        See Also:
        Using the Core API in Java, DropboxStatus

      • noRedirectClientFinishAndSave

        public static AccessData noRedirectClientFinishAndSave(java.lang.String securityCode)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       com.dropbox.core.DbxException
        This method implements the finish step of the Dropbox no-redirect workflow. It calls DbxWebAuthNoRedirect.finish() to finish the Oauth workflow. It then saves the access token returned by finish() and creates some sample files in the Dropbox app folder.
        Parameters:
        securityCode - the security code which was generated by Dropbox and pasted into the client
        Returns:
        AccessData object containing the access token returned by finish()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error creating the token file
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs
        See Also:
        Using the Core API in Java, AccessData
